answers.answer: People coming from Ukraine benefit from the basic service package, medicines, sanitary materials, and medical devices within the social health insurance system, as well as medical services included in national curative health programs, similar to Romanian insured persons.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The rights granted by the Romanian social health insurance system to people fleeing the war in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: People from Ukraine requesting medical services for the first time are registered by healthcare providers in an IT application to receive an identification number in the social health insurance system. This printed document can then be used at any medical unit in Romania.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Registration in the social health insurance system for people coming from the armed conflict area in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: The basic service package includes medical services, medicines, and medical devices provided by a family doctor or specialist, either in ambulatory settings or in hospitals.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The basic service package'.

answers.answer: People in special situations from Ukraine benefit from health insurance rights without paying the social health insurance contribution, the personal contribution for outpatient medicines, and are exempt from co-payment.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'The rights granted by the Romanian social health insurance system to people fleeing the war in Ukraine'.

answers.answer: For people from Ukraine, the family doctor serves as the first contact with the health system and provides any medical service included in the basic medical services package, without requiring them to be registered on their personal list.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: Primary medical care includes curative, preventive, prophylactic, and home medical services, medication administration, as well as additional diagnostic and therapeutic services that the family doctor is trained and equipped to provide.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: Patients with chronic diseases can receive one consultation per month from their family doctor, either in the office or remotely, for therapy continuation and monitoring.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Patients with chronic diseases'.

answers.answer: A family doctor offers preventive services for all age groups at specified intervals, including an annual prevention package for those 40+ covering various health risks, and also includes diabetes detection.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Preventive Services'.

answers.answer: A family doctor detects diabetes in asymptomatic adults aged 18 and over who are overweight/obese or have risk factors, potentially initiating Metformin treatment if blood glucose, oral glucose tolerance test, or glycosylated hemoglobin values are within specific thresholds.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Preventive Services'.

answers.answer: Family doctors can perform procedures such as spirometry, 24-hour ambulatory blood pressure measurement, ECG, various medication administrations, surgical treatment of minor skin conditions like abscesses and superficial wounds, foreign body extraction, and sprained immobilization.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: Home consultations can be provided for immobile individuals, patients with chronic or acute conditions preventing office travel, children aged 0-1 years, and children 0-18 years with infectious-contagious diseases. Patients with chronic diseases can receive one home consultation per month.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Counseling at home or remotely'.

answers.answer: Family doctors can provide remote medical consultations for patients with chronic diseases and for diseases with endemic-epidemic potential that require isolation.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Counseling at home or remotely'.

answers.answer: A family doctor can issue medical documents such as referral tickets, medical prescriptions, medical leave certificates, medical certificates for sick children, and recommendations for home care or medical prosthetic devices (excluding urinary catheters).
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'Family doctor'.

answers.answer: An up-to-date list of family doctors in Bucharest with contact details can be found and downloaded directly from the website.
answers.instruction: Go to website https://dopomoha.ro/en/family-doctor-for-refugees-from-ukraine and read the section under 'List of family doctor in Bucharest'.
